meanings.definition: To cause (something) to fall into disrepair or ruin.
meanings.sent1: Leaving a house empty for years dilapidates it quickly.
meanings.sent2: Neglecting maintenance dilapidates buildings over time.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elves secretly dilapidated the old castle for fun.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury dilapidated the once sturdy walls of the fort.
meanings.sent5: The relentless sun and rain dilapidated the wooden fence beyond repair.

meanings.definition: To fall into disrepair or ruin.
meanings.sent1: Without proper care, buildings dilapidate and crumble.
meanings.sent2: Over time, neglect causes structures to dilapidate.
meanings.sent3: The old car seemed to dilapidate faster than a melting ice cream cone.
meanings.sent4: Her heart dilapidated like an old, forgotten house after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned factory slowly dilapidated into a haunting shell of its former self.
